result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:18 AM Defendant Nicholas D Kostecki in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Nicholas D Kostecki.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Gutierrez states the Defendant has a revocation hearing on December 01, 2022 and requests an adjournment.
ADA Sitzberger does not object.
Preliminary time limits waived. 
The Court will adjourn.
Bail remains as fixed.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.

2:42 PM Defendant Nicholas D Kostecki in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Nicholas D Kostecki.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Luis Gutierrez will be appointed. Preliminary Hearing requested. Time limits were previously tolled but the Court will get it in within the 10 days. Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:15 PM Defendant Nicholas D Kostecki in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court as a friend of the court for Nicholas D Kostecki. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Attorney Gutierrez indicates they are still in the process of screening the defendant based on his employment. Attorney Gutierrez states the defendant is willing to waive time limits to the preliminary hearing. The Court finds good cause to go beyond the 10 days and will set this matter over for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas D Kostecki
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-06-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. 
 Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A/Witness B/Witness C/Witness D/Witness E/Witness F/Witness G/Witness H/Witness I listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant is responsible for payment of GPS monitoring.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

2:35 PM Defendant Nicholas D Kostecki in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant. Public Defenders office to re-evaluate the defendant prior to the next date but given the custody status of the defendant, he will likely qualify.  Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
